statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Miami 63, Sacred Heart 57
article.story: CORAL GABLES, Fla. (AP) -- Guillermo Diaz and Robert Hite each scored 16 points to lead Miami to a 63-57 victory over Sacred Heart on Monday Diaz rebounded from a scoreless game in the Hurricanes' 58-43 loss to Louisville on Saturday by hitting a 3-pointer to help stop Sacred Hart's 15-2 run, and giving Miami a 48-42 with 6:06 remaining in the second half. Denis Clemente followed with a driving layup and the Pioneers never got closer than Drew Shubik's field goal to cut Miami's lead to 60-55 with 30 seconds remaining in the game. Kibwe Trim scored a game-high 17 points and Eugene Pettway added 13 to lead Sacred Heart, which played its third straight road game and first since a 73-64 loss at Monmouth on Dec. 18. Anthony King's two field goals in the first 6:30 of the second half helped Miami build a 41-27 lead. But Brice Brooks scored eight points in a 15-2 run as the Pioneers reduced the Hurricanes' advantage to 45-42 with 6:30 remaining in the second half before Diaz's and Clemente's baskets within a 22-second span secured Miami's lead. Anthony Harris, who hit two 3-pointers, helped the Hurricanes open an 18-5 lead in the first 10 minutes of the game. But Pettway scored two field goals during a 7-0 run to cut Miami's lead to 18-12 with 8:49 remaining in the first half.
